required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of SLC30A8 rs13266634 Genetic Polymorphism on Zinc Supplementation and Glycemic Control in Egyptian Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: Study whether SLC30A8 rs13266634 polymorphism is associated with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) susceptibility in Egyptian patients and study effect of Zn supplementation on glycemic control in patients with type 2 diabetes

primary_outcome.description: genetic screening of SLC30A8 : solute carrier family 30 member 8

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in fasting and 2hr post prandial blood glucose at three months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at base line and after three months

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in HbA1c at three months
change from baseline in lipid profile at three months
secondary_outcome.description: lipid profile: total cholesterol, triglyceride, HDL, LDL.

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in fasting serum insulin at three months
change from baseline in ALT level at three months
change from baseline in total serum Calcium at three months

arm_group.arm_group_label: zinc supplement plus vitamin A and E
arm_group.description: patients will be receiving zinc supplement plus vitamin A and E for 3 months.
patients will be receiving equivalent dose of vitamin A and E only for 3 months
patients will be observed for 3 months

intervention.intervention_name: zinc supplement plus vitamin A and E
intervention.arm_group_label: zinc supplement plus vitamin A and E

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Established diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus.
- Age between 20 and 64 years.
- BMI < 40 kg/m2.
- On fixed oral hypoglycemic dosage for at least 3 months.
- Normal serum creatinine (0.5 to 1.3 mg/dL) with no clinical evidence suggestive kidney disease.
- Normal liver function tests (ALT 7 to 55 U/L, and albumin Ëƒ 3.5 g/dL).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those diagnosed of osteomalacia, chronic alcoholics. Patients with type 1 Diabetes Mellitus.
- Those who were taking multivitamin containing zinc or magnesium or any sort of mineral supplements in the previous three months or hormone replacement therapy (estrogen, progesterone) or chelating therapy such as penicillamine, or anticonvulsant (phenytoin, valproate).
- Those with a history of recent surgery or with concurrent acute illness including infectious disease, trauma, inflammatory bowel disease, malignancy, and active immunological diseases, using corticosteroids.
- Pregnant or intend to be pregnant for t least 3 months or lactating women.
- Those who were receiving insulin preparations as a part of diabetes management.

facility.name: theoutpatient clinics, department of internal medicine, Cairo University teaching hospitals,
